result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall L McWilliams

There are no victims on either case. 

Defense requests a tentative plea/sentencing hearing in December for the Defense to get Dr. reports and for the Defendant to complete assessments. State does not object. Court sets.

Hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Randall L McWilliams in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.  

Defense acknowledges receipt of the information, waives reading and enters Not Guilty pleas.
Parties are still waiting on the blood results.  Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:39 AM Defendant Randall L McWilliams in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Waukesha Police Department Officer Jeremy Bousman sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Campbell.  Cross examination by Attorney Singleton.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Singleton objects to bind over without argument and moves to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  State to file an information.  Attorney Singleton notes the defendant already has a date before the Trial Court and would ask for this to be set for arraignment.  The date previously set before the Trial Court shall remain and be changed to an arraignment.

Court Will Reduce the Cash Bail Down to:  $1,000
CONDITIONS: 
MODIFIED ON 06/20/22:  NOT TO OPERATE ANY MOTOR VEHICLE UNLESS IT IS EQUIPPED WITH AN IID. 
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.   Defendant to have no contact with witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

Bail/bond hearing on June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defense Notice of Motion and Motion To Modify Bail (Reduction of Cash Bail from  $4,000 down to $1,000)
Notice of Representation.

Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Hearing on July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

File not called on the record.
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Randall L McWilliams in court, in custody, with attorney Justin L. Singleton.    

Defense will waive time limits for Prelim  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Release Personal Property, signed by Commissioner Christopher Bailey on June 7, 2022.

10:05 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Randall L McWilliams in court, in custody, with attorney Justin L. Singleton.    

Court conducted sidebar with Attorney Singleton prior to this to going on the record.  
Attorney Singleton requests to be allowed to obtain the defendants personal property to include his wallet with his ATM card, car keys and cell phone so he may effectuate representation.  
Court conducts colloquy with Mr. McWilliams and finds he is releasing his his personal property to Attorney Singleton voluntarily.  
Court orders the jail release the defendants personal property to Attorney Justin Singleton to include his wallet and its contents, his car keys and cell phone.   
The Court will draft an order to provide to the jail and have a copy this afternoon for Attorney Singleton to pick up from the Clerks office.  
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  
Court sets this matter with the defendants other case before Judge Schimel on June 10, 2022 for a status of counsel date and if matter needs to be set for a preliminary hearing, it may be set back before Commissioner Court.   
Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on June 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:38 AM Defendant Randall L McWilliams in court, in custody.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant states he spoke with Attorney James as recent as yesterday and was under the impression that Attorney James would be appearing today.  The Court contacted Attorney James by phone and in the process was able to get Attorney Justin Singleton to appear by phone to provide the Court with an update.  Attorney Singleton states it is his understanding that the defendant was in the process of obtaining a credit card from his personal property in the jail to retain Attorney Singleton.  The defendant confirms he filled out the proper paperwork in order to obtain his credit card information and submitted it to the Sheriff's Department.  Attorney Singleton is asking for another status of counsel date.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  If Attorney Singleton will be appearing, the Court will allow for Attorney Singleton to appear by Zoom but if Attorney James will be appearing he is to appear in person.  Hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

03:04 PM Defendant Randall L McWilliams in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas James for attorney Justin Singleton who appeared by Zoom.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney James states that the Defendantis going to extend is retainer with attorney Singleton and that they are working out the details.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
The Court will adjourn.  Hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
